display.name: Immutable zkEVM
display.description: Immutable zkEVM is a sidechain focused on gaming and powered by Polygon stack. It plans to eventually transition to a ZK Rollup.

reasonsForBeingOther.label: No proofs
reasonsForBeingOther.shortDescription: The proof system isn't fully functional
reasonsForBeingOther.description: Projects without a proper proof system fully rely on single entities to safely update the state. A malicious proposer can finalize an invalid state, which can cause loss of funds.

reasonsForBeingOther.label: No DA bridge
reasonsForBeingOther.shortDescription: There is no data availability bridge
reasonsForBeingOther.description: Projects without a data availability bridge fully rely on single entities (the sequencer) to honestly rely available data roots on Ethereum. A malicious sequencer can collude with the proposer to finalize an unavailable state, which can cause loss of funds.

layer.description: The data is not posted to any data availability layer.

bridge.description: There is no bridge that can attest if the data has been made available.

stateValidation.description: Currently the system permits invalid state roots. More details in project overview.

dataAvailability.description: Proof construction and state derivation rely fully on data that is NOT published onchain.

exitWindow.description: There is no window for users to exit in case of an unwanted regular upgrade since contracts are instantly upgradable.

sequencerFailure.description: There is no mechanism to have transactions be included if the sequencer is down or censoring.

proposerFailure.description: Only the whitelisted proposers can publish state roots on L1, so in the event of failure the withdrawals are frozen.

stateCorrectness.name: No state validation
stateCorrectness.description:
Immutable zkEVM bridge makes use of Axelar network (a Cosmos chain) to transfer assets between Ethereum and Immutable zkEVM. As in any standard Cosmos chain, validators are bonded by staking tokens and can be slashed by social consensus for misbehaviour. 

A deposit starts by a user depositing tokens on the Bridge contract and then the tokens are minted on the destination chain.

Withdrawals to Ethereum can be delayed by a predefined time with a flow rate mechanism that controls outflows of the bridge escrow. The ProxyAdmin or an address with the rate_control role can define so-called buckets for each token: Each bucket has a capacity and a refill rate. All withdrawals that exceed the tokens bucket capacity trigger the withdrawal queue, which delays subsequent withdrawals of *any* of the bridges' assets for a time defined in withdrawalDelay (currently 1d).

risks.text: validators on Axelar decide to not mint tokens after observing an event on Ethereum.
validators decide to mint more tokens than there are locked on Ethereum thus preventing some existing holders from being able to bring their funds back to Ethereum.
validators relay a withdraw request that wasn't originated on the source chain.

permissions.name: OwnerMultisig
permissions.description: A Gnosis Safe with 4 / 6 threshold.  Multisig controlling the ProxyAdmin, potentially stealing all locked funds.

permissions.name: ProxyAdmin
permissions.description: Contract allowed to upgrade the Bridge, its flow rate control and the Axelar adaptor.

addresses.name: RootAxelarBridgeAdaptor
addresses.description: Axelar adaptor contract used by the bridge.

risks.text: a contract receives a malicious code upgrade. There is no delay on code upgrades.
